alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 20 at 9:44PM PST until January 21 at 2:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PST SUNDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 2 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 5 to 7 feet with sets to 8 feet. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, through 6 PM PST Sunday. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 2 AM to 2 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Locations most susceptible to flooding include Cardiff and Seaside State Beaches, portions of Del Mar, La Jolla Shores, Mission Beach, and Imperial Beach. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Swell and surf will peak tonight subsiding Sunday afternoon. Largest surf will be on exposed, west- facing beaches. High tide on Sunday at La Jolla will be 5.6 feet at 539 AM PST.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
